member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.PatchMesh.Tessellate(System.Single,SharpDX.Direct3D9.Mesh)
member.summary: Performs uniform tessellation based on the tessellation level.

param.name: fTessLevel
param.para: Tessellation level. This is the number of vertices introduced between existing vertices. The range of this float parameter is 0 < fTessLevel <= 32.

param.name: meshRef
param.para: Resulting tessellated mesh. See .

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: , E_OUTOFMEMORY.
member.remarks: This function will perform more efficiently if the patch mesh has been optimized using .
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXPatchMesh::Tessellate([In] float fTessLevel,[In] ID3DXMesh* pMesh)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.PatchMesh.TessellateAdaptive(SharpDX.Vector4,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D9.Mesh)
member.summary: Performs adaptive tessellation based on the z-based adaptive tessellation criterion.

param.name: transRef
param.para: Specifies a 4D vector that is dotted with the vertices to get the per-vertex adaptive tessellation amount. Each edge is tessellated to the average value of the tessellation levels for the two vertices it connects.

param.name: dwMaxTessLevel
param.para: Maximum limit for adaptive tessellation. This is the number of vertices introduced between existing vertices. This integer value can range from 1 to 32, inclusive.

param.name: dwMinTessLevel
param.para: Minimum limit for adaptive tessellation. This is the number of vertices introduced between existing vertices. This integer value can range from 1 to 32, inclusive.

param.name: meshRef
param.para: Resulting tessellated mesh. See .

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: , E_OUTOFMEMORY.
member.remarks: This function will perform more efficiently if the patch mesh has been optimized using .
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXPatchMesh::TessellateAdaptive([In] const D3DXVECTOR4* pTrans,[In] unsigned int dwMaxTessLevel,[In] unsigned int dwMinTessLevel,[In] ID3DXMesh* pMesh)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.RenderToEnvironmentMap.OnLostDevice
member.summary: Use this method to release all references to video memory resources and delete all stateblocks. This method should be called whenever a device is lost, or before resetting a device.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be .
member.remarks: This method should be called whenever the device is lost or before the user calls . Even if the device was not actually lost, is responsible for freeing stateblocks and other resources that may need to be released before resetting the device. As a result, the font object cannot be used again before calling and then .

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.RenderToEnvironmentMap.OnResetDevice
member.summary: Use this method to re-acquire resources and save initial state.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be .
member.remarks: ID3DXRenderToEnvMap::OnResetDevice should be called each time the device is reset (using ), before any other methods are called. This is a good place to re-acquire video-memory resources and capture state blocks.

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.SkinInfo.Remap(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates bone influence information to match vertices after they are reordered. This method should be called if the target vertex buffer has been reordered externally.

param.name: numVertices
param.para: Number of vertices to remap.

param.name: vertexRemapRef
param.para: Array of DWORDS whose length is specified by NumVertices.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be .
member.remarks: Each element in pVertexRemap specifies the previous vertex index for that position. For example, if a vertex was in position 3 but has been remapped to position 5, then the fifth element of pVertexRemap should contain 3. The vertex remap array returned by can be used.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXSkinInfo::Remap([In] unsigned int NumVertices,[In] unsigned int* pVertexRemap)

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be .

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.SkinInfo.ConvertToBlendedMesh(SharpDX.Direct3D9.Mesh,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@,SharpDX.Direct3D9.Mesh@)
member.summary: Takes a mesh and returns a new mesh with per-vertex blend weights and a bone combination table. The table describes which bones affect which subsets of the mesh.

param.name: meshRef
param.para: Input mesh. See .

param.name: options
param.para: Currently unused.

param.name: adjacencyInRef
param.para: Input mesh adjacency information.

param.name: adjacencyOutRef
param.para: Output mesh adjacency information.

param.name: faceRemapRef
param.para: An array of DWORDs, one per face, that identifies the original mesh face that corresponds to each face in the blended mesh. If the value supplied for this argument is null, face remap data is not returned.

param.name: vertexRemapOut
param.para: Address of a reference to an interface, which contains a DWORD for each vertex that specifies how the new vertices map to the old vertices. This remap is useful if you need to alter external data based on the new vertex mapping. This parameter is optional; null may be used.

param.name: maxFaceInflRef
param.para: Pointer to a DWORD that will contain the maximum number of bone influences required per vertex for this skinning method.

param.name: numBoneCombinationsRef
param.para: Pointer to the number of bones in the bone combination table.

param.name: boneCombinationTableOut
param.para: Pointer to the bone combination table. The data is organized in a structure.

param.name: meshOut
param.para: Pointer to the new mesh.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be .
member.remarks: Each element in the remap array specifies the previous index for that position. For example, if a vertex was in position 3 but has been remapped to position 5, then the fifth element of pVertexRemap will contain 3.This method does not run on hardware that does not support fixed-function vertex blending.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXSkinInfo::ConvertToBlendedMesh([In] ID3DXMesh* pMesh,[In] unsigned int Options,[In] const unsigned int* pAdjacencyIn,[In] unsigned int* pAdjacencyOut,[In] unsigned int* pFaceRemap,[In] ID3DXBuffer** ppVertexRemap,[In] unsigned int* pMaxFaceInfl,[In] unsigned int* pNumBoneCombinations,[In] ID3DXBuffer** ppBoneCombinationTable,[In] ID3DXMesh** ppMesh)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.SkinInfo.ConvertToIndexedBlendedMesh(SharpDX.Direct3D9.Mesh,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@,SharpDX.Direct3D9.Mesh@)
member.summary: Takes a mesh and returns a new mesh with per-vertex blend weights, indices, and a bone combination table. The table describes which bone palettes affect which subsets of the mesh.

param.name: meshRef
param.para: The input mesh. See .

param.name: options
param.para: Currently unused.

param.name: paletteSize
param.para: Number of bone matrices available for matrix palette skinning.

param.name: adjacencyInRef
param.para: Input mesh adjacency information.

param.name: adjacencyOutRef
param.para: Output mesh adjacency information.

param.name: faceRemapRef
param.para: An array of DWORDs, one per face, that identifies the original mesh face that corresponds to each face in the blended mesh. If the value supplied for this argument is null, face remap data is not returned.

param.name: vertexRemapOut
param.para: Address of a reference to an interface, which contains a DWORD for each vertex that specifies how the new vertices map to the old vertices. This remap is useful if you need to alter external data based on the new vertex mapping. This parameter is optional; null may be used.

param.name: maxVertexInflRef
param.para: Pointer to a DWORD that will contain the maximum number of bone influences required per vertex for this skinning method.

param.name: numBoneCombinationsRef
param.para: Pointer to the number of bones in the bone combination table.

param.name: boneCombinationTableOut
param.para: Pointer to the bone combination table. The data is organized in a structure.

param.name: meshOut
param.para: Pointer to the new mesh.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be .
member.remarks: Each element in the remap arrays specifies the previous index for that position. For example, if a vertex was in position 3 but has been remapped to position 5, then the fifth element of pVertexRemap will contain 3.This method does not run on hardware that does not support fixed-function vertex blending.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXSkinInfo::ConvertToIndexedBlendedMesh([In] ID3DXMesh* pMesh,[In] unsigned int Options,[In] unsigned int paletteSize,[In] const unsigned int* pAdjacencyIn,[In] unsigned int* pAdjacencyOut,[In] unsigned int* pFaceRemap,[In] ID3DXBuffer** ppVertexRemap,[In] unsigned int* pMaxVertexInfl,[In] unsigned int* pNumBoneCombinations,[In] ID3DXBuffer** ppBoneCombinationTable,[In] ID3DXMesh** ppMesh)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFile.CreateEnumObject(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFileEnumObject@)
member.summary: Creates an enumerator object that will read a .x file.
member.param:
The data source. Either: A file name A D3DXF_FILELOADMEMORY structure A D3DXF_FILELOADRESOURCE structure
Depending on the value of loadflags.

param.name: arg1
param.para: Value that specifies the source of the data. This value can be one of the D3DXF_FILELOADOPTIONS flags.

param.name: arg2
param.para: Address of a reference to an interface, representing the created enumerator object.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: D3DXFERR_BADVALUE, D3DXFERR_PARSEERROR.
member.remarks: After using this method, use one of the methods to retrieve a data object.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXFile::CreateEnumObject([In] const void* arg0,[In] unsigned int arg1,[In] ID3DXFileEnumObject** arg2)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFile.CreateSaveObject(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFileSaveObject@)
member.summary: Creates a save object that will be used to save data to a .x file.

param.name: arg0
param.para: Pointer to the name of the file to use for saving data.

param.name: arg1
param.para: Value that specifies the name of the file to which data is to be saved. This value can be one of the File Save Options flags.

param.name: arg2
param.para: Indicates the format to use when saving the .x file. This value can be one of the File Formats flags. For more information, see Remarks.

param.name: arg3
param.para: Address of a reference to an interface, representing the created save object.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: D3DXFERR_BADVALUE, D3DXFERR_PARSEERROR.
member.remarks: After using this method, use methods of the interface to create data objects and to save templates or data.For the saved file format dwFileFormat, one of the binary, legacy binary, or text flags in File Formats must be specified. The file can be compressed by using the optional flag.The file format values can be combined in a logical OR to create compressed text or compressed binary files. If you indicate that the file format should be text and compressed, the file will be written out first as text and then compressed. However, compressed text files are not as efficient as binary text files; in most cases, therefore, you will want to indicate binary and compressed.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXFile::CreateSaveObject([In] const void* arg0,[In] unsigned int arg1,[In] unsigned int arg2,[In] ID3DXFileSaveObject** arg3)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFile.RegisterTemplates(System.IntPtr,SharpDX.PointerSize)

param.name: arg0
param.para: Pointer to a buffer consisting of a .x file in text or binary format that contains templates.

param.name: arg1
param.para: Size of the buffer pointed to by pvData, in bytes.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: D3DXFERR_BADVALUE, D3DXFERR_PARSEERROR.
member.remarks:
The following code fragment provides an example call to RegisterTemplates And example contents for the buffer to which pvData points. #define XSKINEXP_TEMPLATES \ "xof 0303txt 0032\ template XSkinMeshHeader \ { \ <3CF169CE-FF7C-44ab-93C0-F78F62D172E2> \ WORD nMaxSkinWeightsPerVertex; \ WORD nMaxSkinWeightsPerFace; \ WORD nBones; \ } \ template VertexDuplicationIndices \ { \ <B8D65549-D7C9-4995-89CF-53A9A8B031E3> \ DWORD nIndices; \ DWORD nOriginalVertices; \ array DWORD indices[nIndices]; \ } \ template SkinWeights \ { \ <6F0D123B-BAD2-4167-A0D0-80224F25FABB> \ STRING transformNodeName;\ DWORD nWeights; \ array DWORD vertexIndices[nWeights]; \ array float weights[nWeights]; \ Matrix4x4 matrixOffset; \ }" . . . LPD3DXFILE pD3DXFile = null; if ( FAILED (hr = pD3DXFile->RegisterTemplates( (LPVOID)XSKINEXP_TEMPLATES, sizeof( XSKINEXP_TEMPLATES ) - 1 ) ) ) goto End;
All templates must specify a name and a UUID.This method calls the RegisterEnumTemplates method, obtaining an interface reference by calling CreateEnumObject with pvData as the first parameter.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT ID3DXFile::RegisterTemplates([In] const void* arg0,[In] SIZE_T arg1)

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFile.RegisterEnumTemplates(SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFileEnumObject)
member.summary: Registers custom templates, given an enumeration object.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is .If the method fails, the following value will be returned: D3DXFERR_BADVALUE.
member.remarks: When this method is called, it copies templates stored with the , representing the file, to the local template store of the object.If an reference is not available, call the RegisterTemplates method instead.

member.name: M:SharpDX.Direct3D9.XFileData.Lock(SharpDX.PointerSize,System.IntPtr)

param.name: arg0
param.para: Pointer to the size of the .x file data.

param.name: arg1

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is . If the method fails, the following value will be returned: D3DXFERR_BADVALUE.
member.remarks: The ppData reference is only valid during a ... sequence. You can make multiple lock calls. However, you must ensure that the number of lock calls matches the number of unlock calls.Because file data is not guaranteed to be aligned properly with byte boundaries, you should access ppData with UNALIGNED references.Returned parameter values are not guaranteed to be valid due to possible file corruption; therefore, your code should verify the returned parameter values.
